metadata.title: CVE-2020-24513 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Domain-bypass transient execution vulnerability in some Intel Atom(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access. It was discovered that certain Intel Atom processors could expose memory contents stored in microarchitectural buffers. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-24513` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20210608.0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: sbeattie> INTEL-TA-00465 no kernel component to this issue

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20210608.0ubuntu1').
